scotlandyard

Class ScotlandYard

  • java.lang.Object
    • scotlandyard.ScotlandYard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Receiver, ScotlandYardView

    public class ScotlandYard
extends java.lang.Object
implements ScotlandYardView, Receiver
    A class to perform all of the game logic.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScotlandYard

        public ScotlandYard(java.lang.Integer numberOfDetectives,
                    java.util.List<java.lang.Boolean> rounds,
                    ScotlandYardGraph graph,
                    MapQueue<java.lang.Integer,Token> queue,
                    java.lang.Integer gameId)
        Constructs a new ScotlandYard object. This is used to perform all of the game logic.
        Parameters:
        numberOfDetectives - the number of detectives in the game.
        rounds - the List of booleans determining at which rounds Mr X is visible.
        graph - the graph used to represent the board.
        queue - the Queue used to put pending moves onto.
        gameId - the id of this game.

        Parameters:
        move - the move chosen by the player.
        token - the secret token which makes sure the correct player is making the move.

        public java.util.List<Move> validMoves(Colour player)

        the list of valid moves for a given player.

      • spectate

        public void spectate(Spectator spectator)
        Allows spectators to join the game. They can only observe as if they were a detective: only MrX's revealed locations can be seen.
        Parameters:
        spectator - the spectator that wants to be notified when a move is made.

      • join

        public boolean join(Player player,
                    Colour colour,
                    int location,
                    java.util.Map<Ticket,java.lang.Integer> tickets)
        Allows players to join the game with a given starting state. When the last player has joined, the game must ensure that the first player to play is Mr X.
        Parameters:
        player - the player that wants to be notified when he must make moves.
        colour - the colour of the player.
        location - the starting location of the player.
        tickets - the starting tickets for that player.
        Returns:
        true if the player has joined successfully.

      • getPlayers

        public java.util.List<Colour> getPlayers()
        A list of the colours of players who are playing the game in the initial order of play. The length of this list should be the number of players that are playing, the first element should be Colour.Black, since Mr X always starts.
        Specified by:
        getPlayers in interface ScotlandYardView
        Returns:
        The list of players.

      • getWinningPlayers

        public java.util.Set<Colour> getWinningPlayers()
        Returns the colours of the winning players. If Mr X it should contain a single colour, else it should send the list of detective colours
        Specified by:
        getWinningPlayers in interface ScotlandYardView
        Returns:
        A set containing the colours of the winning players

      • getPlayerLocation

        public int getPlayerLocation(Colour colour)
        The location of a player with a given colour in its last known location.
        Specified by:
        getPlayerLocation in interface ScotlandYardView
        Parameters:
        colour - The colour of the player whose location is requested.
        Returns:
        The location of the player whose location is requested. If Black, then this returns 0 if MrX has never been revealed, otherwise returns the location of MrX in his last known location. MrX is revealed in round n when rounds.get(n) is true.

      • getPlayerTickets

        public int getPlayerTickets(Colour colour,
                            Ticket ticket)
        The number of a particular ticket that a player with a specified colour has.
        Specified by:
        getPlayerTickets in interface ScotlandYardView
        Parameters:
        colour - The colour of the player whose tickets are requested.
        ticket - The type of tickets that is being requested.
        Returns:
        The number of tickets of the given player.

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        The game is over when MrX has been found or the agents are out of tickets. See the rules for other conditions.
        Specified by:
        isGameOver in interface ScotlandYardView
        Returns:
        true when the game is over, false otherwise.

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        A game is ready when all the required players have joined.
        Specified by:
        isReady in interface ScotlandYardView
        Returns:
        true when the game is ready to be played, false otherwise.

      • getCurrentPlayer

        public Colour getCurrentPlayer()
        The player whose turn it is.
        Specified by:
        getCurrentPlayer in interface ScotlandYardView
        Returns:
        The colour of the current player.

      • getRound

        public int getRound()
        The round number is determined by the number of moves MrX has played. Initially this value is 0, and is incremented for each move MrX makes. A double move counts as two moves.
        Specified by:
        getRound in interface ScotlandYardView
        Returns:
        the number of moves MrX has played.

      • getRounds

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Boolean> getRounds()
        A list whose length-1 is the maximum number of moves that MrX can play in a game. The getRounds().get(n) is true when MrX reveals the target location of move n, and is false otherwise. Thus, if getRounds().get(0) is true, then the starting location of MrX is revealed.
        Specified by:
        getRounds in interface ScotlandYardView
        Returns:
        a list of booleans that indicate the turns where MrX reveals himself.

        protected PlayerData getPlayer(Colour colour)
